description:
When four hardworking friends pair up to chase their dream of becoming professional stand-up comedians, they quickly find out that being funny is seriously difficult!

Join Fubuki, Mafuyu, Rin, Nayuta, and the rest of their hilarious pals as they overcome obstacles on the journey to achieving their ultimate goal: performing live at the Namba Grand Kagetsu!

(Source: Funimation)

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Gyaru
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who has a distinct American-emulated fashion style, such as tanned skin, bleached hair, and excessive makeup. Also known as gal.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: College
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a college or university.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Rakugo
tags.description: Rakugo is the traditional Japanese performance art of comic storytelling.

node.description:
[Profile (MONACA)](https://monaca.jp/member/kosaki) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MONACA_kosaki)

A Japanese composer and arranger. He joined NAMCO as a soundtrack composer in 1999, and then he joined MONACA Inc. as a music designer in 2004.

Soundtracks he has worked on credited as MONACA: 
- Star Driver: Kagayaki no Takuto (with Keigo Hoashi and Ryuichi Takada) 
- Hourou Musuko (with Keigo Hoashi and Keiichi Okabe) 
- A-Channel (with Kakeru Ishihama, Ryuichi Takada, Keigo Hoashi)

__Machida Touko__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sakuribo)

[Blog](http://halfawake.blog.shinobi.jp/%E8%87%AA%E5%B7%B1%E7%B4%B9%E4%BB%8B/%E7%81%AF%E5%A4%A2) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/LlittleTomBoy) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/halfawakerobotman/)

Tom is a Japanese composite artist and designer affiliated with company [Digital Noise](https://d-noise.co.jp/).

__Machida Touko__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sakuribo)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/鶴岡陽太)

Founder and representative director of [Rakuonsha](https://anilist.co/studio/211/).

__[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100003558003913)__

__Residency:__ Fujisawa, Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan
__Graduated:__ Kugenuma High School, Yoyogi Animation Academy

__Aiko Matsuyama__ is a Japanese color designer and digital painter, who mainly does finishing.

[Website](https://www.heart-company.co.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Saito_S_HC)

Produces and directs music. Founder of Heart Company.

[Website](https://monaca.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MONACA_jp)

__MONACA__ is a Japanese music production studio, which was established by the composer Keiichi Okabe in October 2004.

__Members__:
• [Keiichi Okabe](https://anilist.co/staff/121585/Keiichi-Okabe) (CEO)
• [Satoru Kousaki](https://anilist.co/staff/101555/Satoru-Kousaki)
• [Ryuuichi Takada](https://anilist.co/staff/109459/Ryuuichi-Takada)
• [Kakeru Ishihama](https://anilist.co/staff/150946/Kakeru-Ishihama)
• [Hidekazu Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/141852/Hidekazu-Tanaka)
• [Keiichi Hirokawa](https://anilist.co/staff/156490/Keiichi-Hirokawa)
• [Kuniyuki Takahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/154774/Kuniyuki-Takahashi)
• [Shuotarou Seo](https://anilist.co/staff/317330/Shoutarou-Seo)
• [Oliver Good](https://anilist.co/staff/317296)
• [Keita Inoue](https://anilist.co/staff/229376/Keita-Inoue)

__Past Members__:
• [Yuri Mitsumi](https://anilist.co/staff/201236/Yuri-Misumi)
• [Keigo Hoashi](https://anilist.co/staff/111233/Keigo-Hoashi)

__Education__: Komazawa University, Global Media Department

[Spotify ](https://open.spotify.com/playlist/3JOfDKnXg40s6e8efPiAje?si=ye6zb6QLQUKN16VChNYT-Q&nd=1)

A composer affiliated with MONACA since 2019
